results.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
results.brief_description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. Focuses on women in the workplace from the mid-1800s through to the 1970s including footage of the first women’s union (1882); industrialisation and factory work; the birth of the modern office worker (1890s); equal pay for equal work movement; WWI and WWII women in the workforce; trade-unionism and feminism.

results.title: Skilled craftsmen: five Australians
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A lot of people consider craft a hobby. Something which is undertaken as a source of relaxation and self fulfilment. Many people, however, treat the crafts as a professional livelihood. This film shows the lifestyle of five of these people, each illustrating a different facet of the crafts: Joe McBain, a blacksmith; David Wright, a stained glass artist; Lilija Duks, a weaver; Greg Wain and Victoria Howlett, potters. Narrated by Rod Mullinar

results.title: Making glass for houses
results.brief_description: Sand, limestone, and soda ash are the raw materials of glass; this film shows how they are obtained, and how they are manufactured into glass, both in the laboratory, and in a modern industrial plant, and the many uses of glass in houses.

results.title: Lease of life
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Presents the Victorian Cancer Institute’s 4MeV linear accelerator. An important weapon against cancer, it is used for deep X-ray therapy. Traces a case history of a woman who is eventually restored to her family by the special treatment made possible by the accelerator. Narrated by Marcia Hart. Filmed at the Peter MacCallum Cancer Institute in Melbourne, Victoria.

results.title: Thing of Beauty
results.brief_description: The restoration of the interior of Parliament House, Melbourne is a time-consuming and delicate process-making replicas and replacing the Victorian baroque moulded plaster decorations, applying gold-leaf less than a thousandth of an inch thick, retouching the highlights of the mouldings and repainting the walls and surrounds with the original sky-blue - but the result is both eccentric and splendid

results.title: Sheep in the desert
results.brief_description: Shows how sheep can be raised successfully in low rainfall areas of Australia. It concentrates on one large station, Wilgena, nearly two million acres in extent and carrying 45,000 sheep. This station is self supporting, generating its own power and light, and is fitted with the most modern appliances. It produces sheep of fine quality and is entirely mechanised, the sheep being rounded up by men on motor bikes. In an area with an average rainfall of only 5 and a half inches, much needed water is supplied by sub-artesian bores. Vermin-proof fences check pasture destruction by rabbits and stock losses by dingoes.

results.title: [Remix: ACMI Collection 2]
results.brief_description:
This playful short film set to music, is a tribute to the gems in the ACMI Collection. A remix of home movies and short works from the collection featuring elements on ‘how a movie is made’ and a split screen collage of moving images, interspersed with intertitles. The work was initially designed as part of a fundraising campaign.

ACMI gratefully acknowledge the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Australian Dried Fruits Association; John Richardson; Tasmanian Archive and Heritage Office; Ivan Gaal; Wine Australia and Tony Agapitos.

results.title: Whole School Planning
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Case studies in effective schooling”.
Case studies in effective schooling presents first hand accounts of how individual schools have improved their effectiveness. The first episode, “Whole school planning” looks at planning as a manageable series of arrangements designed to involve all interested parties and to make the best use of limited resources. Deer Park Secondary College features in this case study.

results.title: A Floral pageant
results.brief_description: Victoria celebrates 100 years of self government. Shots of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Government House, but mainly the procession along Elizabeth Street. Beginning title says “Presented by Ted Waterford”.
